reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions the data collected when using the app and the conditions under which it is collected.
reply.reference: The following data is processed in the course of using our app: General app accesses, E-mail address, User Generated Content, Push messages ('Message_Usage'), Network access, General app accesses. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy

data to ensure stability and security for you.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects the following types of data: general app accesses, e-mail address, user-generated content, push messages, network access, IP address, user agent, date and time, time zone difference, specific page content, access status, HTTP status code, data transmitted, website source, browser, operating system, browser language and version.

reply.analysis: The data types collected by the app are clearly mentioned in the privacy policy, providing a comprehensive list of the information processing.
reply.reference: The app collects the following data: General app accesses, E-mail address, User Generated Content, Push messages ('Message_Usage'), Network accesses, IP address, User agent, Date and time of request, Time zone difference, Specific page content, Access status, HTTP status code, Amount of data transferred in each case, Website from which request came, Browser, Operating system and its interface, Language and version of the browser software. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use in the privacy policy document.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the purpose of processing different types of data collected by the app, such as contact emails and data collected when using the app, indicating transparency in data collection purposes.
reply.reference: The purpose of processing the above-mentioned data is to process the contact enquiry and to be able to contact the enquirer in order to respond to the request. The purpose of this processing is the retrievability of our app from your device and to enable a correct display of our app on your device or in your browser. Furthermore, we use the data to optimise our app and to ensure the security of our systems. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection by deactivating the push service in the respective system settings of the operating system of their device.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can prevent their data from being processed further by deactivating the push service in the system settings of their device, indicating the ability to opt out of data collection.
reply.reference: You can prevent your data from being processed further by deactivating the push service in the respective system settings of the operating system of your device. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy

Data subject rights
In principle, you have the following rights:
Right to information (Art. 15 GDPR).
Right to rectification (Art. 16 GDPR)
Right to object (Art. 21 GDPR)
Right to erasure (Art. 17 GDPR)
Right to restriction of processing (Art. 18f. GDPR)
Right to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR)
For requests of this nature, please contact u...

necessary for the conclusion of a contract. You are also not obliged to provide the personal data. However, failure to provide the data could result in you not being able to use our app or not being able to use it to its full extent. The legal basis for this data processing is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a) GDPR.

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app may share data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy indicates that data can be shared with third parties bound by professional secrecy. This implies that the app may indeed share data with third parties.
reply.reference: we involve third parties bound to professional secrecy to enforce our claims. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with Google LLC, Google Ireland Limited, and Apple Inc.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that the app shares data with Google and Apple. This indicates that the app shares data with Google LLC, Google Ireland Limited, and Apple Inc.
reply.reference: Google LLC, Google Ireland Limited, Apple Inc. URL: https://www.genaufactory.com/genau-data-privacy
